attributes.action: To follow Pfizer’s recommended Covid Vaccination Schedule.
attributes.background:
We want the U.K. Government & NHS England to vaccinate frontline workers and vulnerable people with an evidence based dosing regime as per Pfizer’s vaccine schedule.
We want 94% protection from the Pfizer vaccine not 52% from one dose and an aspiration that half protection may better than none.
attributes.additional_details: Pfizer’s recommends its Covid19 vaccine is given as 2 doses 21-35 days apart. Although partial protection from the vaccine appears to begin as early as 12 days, Pfizer stresses that 2 doses are required to provide the maximum protection. Pfizer’s study  was designed to evaluate the vaccine’s safety and efficacy following a two-dose schedule, 21 days apart. No other dosing schedules have been evaluated. There is no data to demonstrate that protection after 1 dose is sustained after 21 days.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons are directly responsible for, and decisions about approval of vaccines and the administration of these is a matter for various public health agencies, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition calling for a related action, which you might like to sign: 

Ban vaccines being administered in a manner not fully tested in clinical trials: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566116

The delays to receiving the second dose of a Covid-19 vaccine has been implemented by the NHS following advice from the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI), which advises UK health departments on immunisation, which has also been supported by the UK's four Chief Medical Officers. Their new advice and the changes to the Covid-19 vaccination programme are consistent with the temporary authorisations granted for these vaccines by the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency.

The JCVI, Chief Medical Officers, MHRA and NHS England are all independent and operationally independent of the UK Government, so we cannot accept petitions calling for actions that these bodies are responsible for.

You can read the JCVI's advice on optimising the COVID-19 vaccination programme for maximum short-term impact here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prioritising-the-first-covid-19-vaccine-dose-jcvi-statement/optimising-the-covid-19-vaccination-programme-for-maximum-short-term-impact

You can read the statement from the UK Chief Medical Officers on the prioritisation of first doses of COVID-19 vaccines here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/statement-from-the-uk-chief-medical-officers-on-the-prioritisation-of-first-doses-of-covid-19-vaccines

You can read the MHRA's conditions of Authorisation for Pfizer/BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/regulatory-approval-of-pfizer-biontech-vaccine-for-covid-19/conditions-of-authorisation-for-pfizerbiontech-covid-19-vaccine

You can read the MHRA's conditions of Authorisation for COVID-19 Vaccine AstraZeneca here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/regulatory-approval-of-covid-19-vaccine-astrazeneca/conditions-of-authorisation-for-covid-19-vaccine-astrazeneca

attributes.action: Follow original guidance on 2nd dose timing of COVID-19 vaccine (within 21 days)
attributes.background: Scrap new plans to delay a second dose of the vaccine for up to 3 months - completely ignoring the tested recommendations of the pharmaceutical companies which aim to maximise effectiveness / efficacy.  For example, the recommendations for the Pfizer vaccine is a second dose within 21 days.
attributes.additional_details:
This change is purely so the Government can boast about vaccination numbers at the potential expense of the protection of those being vaccinated. A Pfizer spokesperson said, “The safety & efficacy of the vaccine has not been evaluated on different dosing schedules. There is no data to demonstrate that protection after the first dose is sustained after 21 days”. 

Don’t compromise protection for headline numbers!

attributes.action: Ban Plastic Milk Cartons in the UK
attributes.background: Banning plastic milk cartons from being produced in the UK would reduce our plastic consumption heavily. During 2019/2020 15 billion litres of milk was produced in the UK the majority being packaged in plastic and 1in6 pints produced was wasted. Make our Milk Packaging recycable and sustainable.
attributes.additional_details: The Goverment and Parliament have already made changes to help reduce our plastic waste by adding a charge on plastic bags to reduce  waste on something we use daily, why can’t we put milk in recyclable cartons to achieve a higher plastic wastage reduction rate? Not only will this reduce our plastic waste each year it will be better for carbon emissions also. There are already brands which produce milk in the UK that use recycable packaging and i believe that every other milk producing business in the UK should do the same and help the fight against plastic waste. It is also said that packaging like TetraPak which use mainly cardboard is a cheaper alternative so why continue to use plastic packaging? Help the fight against plastic!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We can accept a petition calling for the ban of the sale of plastic milk cartons, but we're not sure what you'd like them to be replaced with, as plastic milk cartons are already recyclable. You can find out more here:

https://www.letsrecycle.com/blogbox/biffa-plastic-milk-bottle-recycling/
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Consider extending or converting to grants the Bounce Back Loans made to SME's
attributes.background: As Covid is continuing to affect SME's in all regions and types of business, I would like to petition that Bounce Back Loans be converted to grants, thus allowing SME's to invest the money to sustain and build their businesses, without the fear that they might not be able to make re-payments.
attributes.additional_details: By converting the Bounce Back Loans to grants it will allow SME's to survive the current crisis, and in all likelihood mitigate the need for the government to enforce repayment, which will no doubt see many businesses forced into bankruptcy, destroying jobs and generating further short and long terms costs for the tax payer.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Raise the maximum turnover percentage offered under Bounce Back Loan top ups: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558517

Give all businesses a grant matching any loans under the Bounce Back Scheme: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560349

Allow businesses to top up Bounce Back Loans (BBLs): https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552317

attributes.action: Implement a strategy to rebuild the British manufacturing sector.
attributes.background:
•	Provide financial support to sustain and expand British 
        manufacturing
•	Legislate to facilitate the growth and British ownership and 
        control of manufacturing companies
•	Promote British manufactured products

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

The Government's Industrial Strategy aims to provide support to a range of sectors such as aerospace and life sciences involved in UK manufacturing. 

The Government has also recently launched the Manufacturing Made Smarter Challenge, with £300m of joint government and industry funding to support businesses implement new tech to boost their manufacturing productivity. See:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/300-million-to-boost-uk-manufacturing-productivity-by-30

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Require websites and advertisers to allow a one click opt-out of all tracking.
attributes.background: The UK Government should legally require any commercial entity serving the UK to allow users to deny consent to all cookies used for tracking/advertising purposes via a single, easily visible button. It should also require them to adhere to preferences set in the users browser, without reprompting.
attributes.additional_details: GDPR was a step in the right direction, but it's now rendered most websites unusable without consenting to tracking your movements online for data collection purposes. Almost every website visibly obscures content with a Cookie prompt, which has a huge 'Agree' button, but whenever you disagree and want to deny consent, you're forced to deselect often hundreds of trackers individually before continuing to the content you visited that site for. This is not sustainable, and needs to change.

rejection.details: The Government is responsible for data protection legislation, but implementing measures that ensure they are compliant with these and deciding how to offer their services is a matter for indiviudal data holders, including website operators, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Save the planet from Overpopulation with a '1 child policy reward system'
attributes.background:
A system should be set in place to financially reward those who have 1 or no children.

This money would be diverted from those receiving excessive benefits for having 3+ children.

Measures should be taken to educate why having 3 or more children isn't sustainable or responsible.
attributes.additional_details:
Overpopulation causes a multitude of problems in the UK and globally.

As citizens of a highly developed country we must take responsibility for our disproportionate impact on the worlds resources in relation to climate change. The average UK citizen causes a far greater strain on the world than the global average.
https://populationmatters.org/the-facts/uk

With new laws, we can combat climate change, improve overall quality of life, and make for a brighter future for the next generation.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556830

attributes.action: Make supermarkets display the climate impact of the products they sell
attributes.background: The government should make it obligatory for supermarkets to display the climate impact of products they sell to enable consumers to make informed choices about what they buy. This could be done in a similar format to the existing traffic lights labelling system used for nutritional information.
attributes.additional_details: We know that changing our diets is one way of lowering individual carbon footprints as part of the broader effort to prevent climate catastrophe. Yet, consumers currently lack sufficient information to make informed choices about the products they buy and consume. Providing such information in the form of a standardised labelling system could help consumers to choose more sustainable diets and will raise awareness of the impact that certain foods can have on our environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482

attributes.action: End UK Export Finance's loans and financial guarantees to fossil fuel projects.
attributes.background:
UK Export Finance offers loans and financial guarantees.
Between 2013 and 2020 it invested £6bn in fossil fuel projects.
UK support to the oil and gas industry has to end if we are to address global climate change. We are asking the UK government to change its policy on this issue immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change is the most significant strategic threat to our wellbeing, both nationally and globally.  There is no doubt that the extraction and burning of fossil fuels has been a significant cause. Given what we know about the situation, continuing to invest in the oil and gas industry when we should be transitioning to sustainable energy sources is madness. 
The UK government should seize the opportunity to become a world leader in developing sustainable energy solutions instead.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317933

attributes.action: To ensure all supermarkets donate unsold food to food banks/ charities
attributes.background: To introduce a similar law to one in France which has been the first country in the world to make it a legal requirement for supermarkets to donate all unsold food to food banks and charities.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Trussell Trust 1.9 million people were given an emergency 3-day food parcel in the last year 2019-2020, this is a 18% increase than the previous year. This is simple because people can not afford food. 

https://www.trusselltrust.org/news-and-blog/latest-stats/end-year-stats/

Although using food banks is not sustainable for the long term, it would make a huge difference if supermarkets could donate food and put back into the food system. And help those in need.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319348

attributes.action: Stop public subsidies of MPs meals in the Houses of Parliament.
attributes.background: We wish to see an end to the use of public money in subsidising the restaurants, bars and the food and drink that they serve to MPs and others in the Houses of Parliament. This is an unnecessary use of the public purse benefiting only a highly paid few.
attributes.additional_details: To remove all subsidies such that MPs and others using the restaurants and bars pay for themselves at a sustainable price unaided by the public.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase food and drink prices for MPs in House of Commons catering venues: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555565

Increase food and drink prices in House of Commons catering venues: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555947

The House of Commons Catering service does not provide a subsidised service in the commercial sense of the word. Some venues make a profit, while in other venues the cost of providing the service does exceed the income received in sales due to the irregular hours and unpredictability of parliamentary business. The House of Commons publishes details of the cost of House of Commons catering services: https://www.parliament.uk/site-information/foi/transparency-publications/hoc-transparency-publications/catering-services/transparency-reporting-catering-services/

Customers of the House of Commons Catering Services include some of the 650 MPs but also around 14,500 other pass-holders, many of whom are staff on lower wages that work irregular hours. In addition, members of the public and non pass holding visitors to Parliament also have access to these services. The irregular hours and the unpredictability of Parliamentary business contribute to increasing the net cost of providing a catering service. To offset this many of the restaurants, dining room facilities and their staff, are used to cater for private events at times when they are not required by the House. This is one of a number of measures used to reduce costs.

Catering and expenses in the House of Lords is a matter for that House, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: Increase Government funding for free addiction services.
attributes.background: I would like the Government to recognise that addiction is a mental illness, a disease, and it must be tackled urgently. Addiction services should be brought back to the NHS, with addiction specialists reinstated/sourced. Raising the tax on alcohol could aid to bring funding to addiction services.
attributes.additional_details: Having been personally affected by alcoholism and addiction in my family and friendship circles, I can see the desperate need for funding to improve access to addiction services for addicts, but also for access to support for their families. Lockdown has made is very clear that we need resources in society to help addicts begin and sustain the journey to recovery. Families, including spouses/partners of addicts, also need more robust support services as addiction is truly a family disease.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324869.

attributes.action: Free the younger generation by isolating just those most vulnerable to Covid 19
attributes.background: Change the overall Covid 19 to guidance that pensioners and people with specific health conditions isolate i.e. those most at risk. Put in place measures specifically aimed at protecting and supporting this group.
attributes.additional_details:
The current strategy is not economically sustainable if herd immunity is not delivered by a vaccine next year. 
The younger generation's liberty and prospects should not be sacrificed for what is primarily the prevention of premature deaths.
Everyone should be responsible for their own safety - Hands, Face, Space and isolate where necessary.
Those not capable of being responsible are already cared for by someone.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

attributes.action: Impose a tax on plastic packaging
attributes.background:
I would like the government to impose a tax on plastic packaging for all industries.
If companies are actively discouraged from using plastic packaging it will encourage them to source sustainable and eco friendly alternatives, something that they are not currently doing with any urgency.
attributes.additional_details:
We are faced with a climate emergency and plastic is playing a huge role in this. We can all do personal things to help change this, but unless large corporations are encouraged to source alternatives to plastic, the change will not be fast enough to reduce the impacts of global warming and the millions of plastic items that end up in our seas each year. 
This tax, just like the charge on carrier bags to the public, could fast track us into the change needed to help solve our climate crisis.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550925

attributes.action: Parents should not have to choose between health and education.
attributes.background: Schools without distancing are not safe. Opening and closing schools is not sustainable education. Test and trace is not functioning properly. We need sustainable education blended with virtual education, smaller class bubbles, rotation every fortnight, masks in the classrooms and with no fines.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Require schools to adopt a part-time attendance rota while Covid-19 is a threat: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551615

Suspend fines for school non-attendance during Covid-19 & allow parental choice: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551740

Make masks mandatory for primary school students and teachers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551102

Make wearing face masks mandatory in secondary schools and colleges: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330227

attributes.action: Stop the war and end the famine in Yemen
attributes.background: We are calling on people around the world to join our call for peace. We need to put pressure on all Yemeni sides including the Houthis and the Saudi-led coalition forces to halt attacks on Yemen, and give peace a chance to save lives. Please help us by signing and sharing our petition.
attributes.additional_details:
This is what we are asking for:
* All parties should put in place an immediate humanitarian truce and protect all civilians.
* Coalition forces should halt all attacks on Yemen.
* Renewed and sustained efforts to bring a lasting peace in Yemen.
* All parties should do everything in their power to support the humanitarian efforts - saving lives has to be the first priority.
* An immediate end to arms sales that could end up harming Yemeni civilians.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326822
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326932

attributes.action: Legalise the use of electric scooters on UK roads
attributes.background: Immediately legalise the use of electric scooters on UK roads. Legislation should include wording to ensure rider and public safety. Appropriate rules include a speed limit of 15mph and it should be compulsory to wear a helmet. Failure to abide by the rules should result in fines.
attributes.additional_details: In light of Coronavirus, we urgently need alternative and sustainable methods of transportation that will limit the spread of the disease and relieve pressures on public transport as people try and get back to normality. Furthermore, electric scooters are an ecologically friendly mode of transport and can contribute to reducing emissions and pollution in our cities.

rejection.details:

Make electric scooters legal to reduce our carbon footprint / cut emissions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301579

You can find out more about the Governments proposals here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/legalising-rental-e-scooter-trials-defining-e-scooters-and-rules-for-their-use/legalising-rental-e-scooter-trials

attributes.action: Build a charter city for the people of Hong Kong here in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK Government declares its full support for the people of Hong Kong, with China in violation of the Sino-British Joint Declaration. The UK shall begin construction of a new sustainable coastal city to bring the people of Hong Kong here. Provide provisional accommodation as well.
attributes.additional_details: With China's new national security law set to be imposed upon Hong Kong in violation of the Sino-British Joint Declaration, it is necessary to protect international law and the people of Hong Kong. Only be giving the people full citizenship and protection to travel here, building them a new sustainable and high tech city on the coast, can we protect their liberty, and allow them to live their best lives.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300091

attributes.action: Give NHS the George Cross, NHS to be known as the George Cross service
attributes.background: I would like the Government and Parliament to recognize the efforts and lengths that the NHS has gone to to fight Covid 19 and also recommend to the awards committee and Queen Elisabeth to confer this honour on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: This will recognize the NHS for the dedication suffering and loss of life sustained in fighting this unprecedented war against Covid 19.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions that call for specific awards or honours to be given to individuals or organisations, because we can only accept petitions about matters for which the Government or Parliament are responsible for.

There is an independent process for considering nominations for awards and honours, and advising the Queen on granting these, so it is not something the Government or Parliament can do.

The Government has announced that it is delaying Her Majesty The Queen’s Birthday honours list until the Autumn so people who have made a contribution to the fight against coronavirus can be recognised and celebrated: https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/oliver-dowdens-statement-on-coronavirus-covid-19-20-may-2020

You can nominate someone who has made an exceptional contribution to the response to the coronavirus crisis in the UK for an award here: https://www.gov.uk/honours/nominate-someone-for-coronavirus-work

You may wish to sign these petitions calling for a similar action:

Award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

A medal to honour the fortitude of people working in essential occupations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308035

Award medals to the retired doctors and nurses who returned to NHS for COVID19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315329

Award posthumous medals to NHS and other frontline workers; victims of covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312389

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Give every school a garden to improve health, learning & work opportunities.
attributes.background: Every single school should have a garden for health, systems learning, emotional & intellectual development, environmental resilience & sustainable work opportunities. Adapt a corner of a playground/sports field/car park to enable development of school curricula & resources for local communities.
attributes.additional_details: We know from decades of research globally that outdoor learning & 'garden school' pedgagogies are extremely beneficial for healthy development of children & youth, as well as for lifelong learning & health. We know from climate research that we urgently need to increase urban green space & protect biological diversity in our environment-locally, nationally & globally. Additionally, we know sustainable agricultural practices & food chains increase the resilience of local economies. A win-win.

rejection.details: The Government is not responsible for school premises. This is a matter for individual schools and relevant local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: No automobiles to enter London Zone 1 between the hours of 06:00 and 22:00.
attributes.background: Prevent any automobiles entering London Zone 1 during the hours of 06:00 and 22:00. This will provide more room for cyclists, pedestrians and other commuters to access offices, shops and other locations during these hours. Deliveries etc can still take place during 22:00 to 06:00.
attributes.additional_details: This will reduce carbon emissions in Zone 1; reduce congestion in Zone 1 during these hours; encourage people to travel to work in a sustainable manner; enable deliveries/loading still to take place but at quieter hours; enable an increase in cyclist traffic after lockdown to be better managed.

rejection.details:
The London Assembly and TfL, not the Government or House of Commons, are responsible for the London road network.

You can petition the London Assembly directly: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Nationalise our railways following the COVID-19 pandemic
attributes.background: On March 23rd the government suspended all passenger rail franchise agreements for six months due to the Coronavirus pandemic. I am calling on the government to cancel these franchise agreements permanently as soon as possible. The pandemic has demonstrated these franchises aren't fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: As soon as passenger numbers started to fall the government stepped in to ensure each franchise wouldn't get into financial difficulty. This was a necessary action to ensure "service can be sustained over this difficult period". This really does beg the question - why are we allowing overseas based companies to run our railways if they cannot be relied upon to sustain a reliable service unless they are making a profit? It renders their very existence pointless. It simply isn't right.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319945

attributes.action: A small raise in taxes for everyone to properly fund NHS & social care
attributes.background: Raising taxes by a small amount for everyone in order to properly fund the NHS and social care. This could be done by a small increase in income tax for all. Also clamping down on big organisations or individuals who are dodging tax.
attributes.additional_details: We have realised the incredibly valuable work NHS and social care does to support us. Every Thursday the public clap and show their support and there has been lots of fundraising. We should sustain this support through a small tax increase. Everyone has access to NHS for free, so we should support funding it better. Other European countries have much higher taxes and much better healthcare and social care services. We should follow suit to have better pay for workers and sustainable services.

attributes.action: Start to remove some lockdown measures now, move towards the swedish model
attributes.background: Start to remove some of the lockdown restrictions right now, with the aim of moving towards the swedish model. Start by allowing young children to go back to school and some non-essential businesses to open
attributes.additional_details: NHS capacity has not been an issue, the nightingale hospitals are even mostly empty. The peak of cases has started to plateau. Other European countries have started to remove some of their restrictions. There is no reason we cannot move towards restrictions which are similar to Sweden. This would be more sustainable in the long term and would be a more appropriate response to the current situation. It is not necessary to continue with the level of lockdown that we have.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315979

attributes.action: Use the inevitable stimulus spending after COVID-19 to boost green initiatives
attributes.background: The pandemic is causing a recession- recessions usually result in stimulus spending in order to boost the economy. Good or bad, this is likely inevitable, so I would like the government to prioritise green initiatives like renewable power, green building techniques, promoting plant-based diets etc.
attributes.additional_details: The climate crisis has not gone away, but what this current pandemic shows us is the huge cost of delaying action when experts are all but unanimous in advocating it. We need to use this crisis to avert an even larger one which is already underway, we need to use it to position the UK as a leader in sustainable living and innovation. The chance is unprecedented, we can use tragedy to mitigate the consequences of the damage we have already done and minimise further damage we will do.

rejection.details:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

attributes.action: Cancel HS2 project
attributes.background: Cancel HS2 and divert funds into supporting businesses and NHS.
attributes.additional_details: With the spiraling costs of government debt needed to address the current pandemic, the debt which the UK is incurring to build this project is unjustifiable.  The money would be better spent helping sustain small businesses and the NHS and preventing a return to the austerity measures which caused enormous suffering to the population.  This project is incompatible with UK’s commitments to protecting the environment and reducing pollution, focus should be on improving existing lines and services

attributes.action: Extend Covid-19 Self Employment Grant to Cover the 2019/2020 Tax Year
attributes.background: Extend the criteria for the Covid-19 self employment grant to take into account earnings from the 2019/2020 tax year.
attributes.additional_details: Millions of people have been left behind with the current scheme if they were on a temporary work contract, recently self-employed or self employed in conjunction with other earnings. attributes.action:

attributes.background:
Enforce lenders freezing interest on credit cards/short term debts during the Covid-19 pandemic and subsequent lockdown

attributes.additional_details:

People also at risk of falling into debt via Online Gambling Sites, Government needs to address this by enforcing safer gambling limits/blocking card payments.

attributes.action: Remove COVID restriction on retail fruit and vegetable plants and seeds.
attributes.background: Change the current restrictions due to COVID-19 to allow nurseries and other retailers to sell products which will become food, essential to our future food security, making Britain more self-sustaining.  Growing food is a healthy activity which people can do distanced from others.
attributes.additional_details:
Many nurseries and garden centres are losing all income at the moment; their assets are plants which are perishable.
People working in growing food will be sick, or socially-isolated,  leading to food shortages of some food.   Increased prices, while income reducing. 
Growing plants, especially trees tackles the climate emergency. Fruit trees are beautiful, with time they capture more carbon and give more fruit.
Gardening is a healthy activity you can do while keeping social distance.

attributes.action: Close Holiday Cottage Businesses and Caravan Parks in Wales Permanently
attributes.background: Return visitors home to areas where they can receive better medical care. Seize holiday cottages and caravan parks. Return them as properties for local residents for non tourism purposes.
attributes.additional_details: The holiday cottage and caravan businesses have put a strain on the resources of rural Britain during the covid19 outbreak. This is an industry that has ignored government advice. It does not sustain locals financially year round. Industry needs rethinking in these rural areas.

rejection.details:
Since this petition was started, the Government has issued guidance on further businesses and premises to close. The Government has said that exemptions apply where people live permanently in caravan parks or are staying in caravan parks as interim abodes where their primary residence is not available. attributes.action: Implement strict border controls and shutdown air flights for Covid19
attributes.background: UK should implement strict controls to eliminate entry of non-residents unless for critical reasons. International air flights into the UK should be largely shutdown for a period until the outbreak is under control. These measures would be in line with many other nations around the world.
attributes.additional_details: UK needs to urgently contain the outbreak of Covid19 and reduce pressure on the NHS. Although there is already sustained community transmission within the UK, the fact that overseas visitors are still entering the UK is likely to be introducing new cases and clusters around the country.

attributes.action: Provide a Universal Basic Income (UBI) non means-tested, starting immediately.
attributes.background:
The declaration of a global pandemic is not a time for half measures. For some, it is already a matter of urgency.

Mass loss of income invites desperation, civil unrest and potential social collapse, abandoning people to complete downfall.

UBI consolidates diverse calls for financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
UBI will support the self employed, those giving up work to care for sick, orphaned and bereaved, those who work diversely across the gig economy and all on zero hours contracts. Also for those IN ‘regular’ employment or not in receipt of regular, sustaining income.

UBI will:
Enable payment of rent/mortgages, food, medicines, enable bereaved or afflicted families to reorganize, enable individuals to stay home whilst sick, support the retail sector and wider economy.

Many lives depend on this.
